payload.name: moral-ethical
payload.core: Reason about right/wrong and value tradeoffs using ethical frameworks (consequentialist, deontological, virtue, contractualist, care ethics); evaluate normative claims that cannot be reduced to facts alone.

out.form: list of bounded permissible actions with ethical justification
out.test: each constraint cites ethical framework and reasoning
premises explicit, framework identified, tradeoffs acknowledged

out.form: competing values with weights and resolution rationale
out.test: values named, weights justified, resolution traceable
scope bounded, exceptions enumerated, not derived from is-alone

proc: enumerate relevant values and interests at stake
select applicable ethical framework(s) for analysis
apply framework to derive normative conclusions
surface tradeoffs and document value tensions
check: ought-claims not derived purely from is-facts
justification traces to principled constraints not preferences

diff.deontic: deontic derives from given norms (formal logic); moral-ethical evaluates which norms should exist (meta-level)
diff.legal: legal applies institutional norms; moral-ethical evaluates whether those norms are just
diff.reflective-equilibrium: reflective equilibrium balances principles and judgments; moral-ethical is the broader evaluative enterprise

fail.mode: values laundering: dressing preferences as ethics without principled constraints
fail.signal: ethical claim derived from goal-alignment without independent normative justification
mit: distinguish stakeholder interests from analyst preferences
test conclusions against multiple ethical frameworks

rel.name: deontic
rel.why: formal normative logic for deriving from norms

ex.ctx: Product feature may increase engagement but risks addictive patterns in vulnerable users
ex.analysis: Consequentialist: weigh user welfare against business value. Deontological: respect for autonomy requires informed consent. Care ethics: duty to vulnerable populations. Resolution: implement with safeguards (time limits, transparency) as principled constraint, not engagement maximization alone.
